review:
This game peaked in like the 2 years after it came out where we worshipped the voice actors and actresses on Insta and 
Tiktok, let alone the (female) Cosplayers. After that it went downhill with design choices, queerbait and a vast increase in dubious monetarisation. 
Overwatch® 2 topped it all with the lies about a supposedly free PVE expansion that never came, or well now that it has it costs you money, duh. I particularly enjoyed the bluntest and most shameless survey about what people would be willing to pay for certain types of cosmetics shortly before Overwatch® 2 was announced (which of you said 20 bucks for a damn skin would be okay? lol). 
So yeah now we have a game that is trying to sell itself as what it used to be at launch (TF2 but with boobies). When in reality its just another battle past wage slave game where you have nothing to gain aside from a negative credit rating. 
If you want a comp experience just play LoL, if you want the porn go to certain patreons and subreddits, if you want the team shooter experience (which I doubt if you play Overwatch® 2) play TF2. I don't know what you should play if you want the PVE experience since Overwatch® PVE was never special and most people I know just did it for those sweet sweet omnic sprays. Maybe Destiny or Warframe? Lost ArK or WoW? Depends on what you want I guess.
Eh

几年来，我一直是守望的忠实玩家，在游戏中投入了大量的时间和金钱。当得知开发商决定从中国撤出，并将我这样的玩家排除在官方活动之外时，我感到非常沮丧。

作为一名老粉丝，我觉得自己被这个决定抛弃和忽视了。看到我曾经热爱的游戏发生这样的转变，我感到非常失望。我理解商业决策的复杂性，但开发商缺乏沟通和透明度只会增加玩家群体的挫败感。守望2的免费发布，对于我们这些全心全意支持守望的人来说，无异于一记响亮的耳光。

我坚信，游戏社区应该具有包容性和全球性，将来自不同国家的玩家聚集在一起。ban掉中国玩家，感觉就像我们被当作二等玩家对待，这既不公平也不公正。我当然希望开发商重新考虑他们的决定，并找到一种能让所有人都可以成为英雄的方法。如果开发商能对其行为背后的原因做出透明的解释，我将不胜感激，因为这将有助于像我一样的人更好地了解情况。

总之，我对暴雪的发展方式感到非常失望，我操你妈

I have been a loyal player of Overwatch for several years and have invested a lot of time and money in the game. I was dismayed to learn that the developers decided to pull out of China and exclude players like me from official events.

As a long-time fan, I felt abandoned and neglected by this decision. It was very disappointing to see such a shift in the game I once loved. I understand the complexity of business decisions, but the lack of communication and transparency from the developers only adds to the frustration of the player base. The free-to-play release of Overwatch 2 is a slap in the face to those of us who wholeheartedly supported Overwatch.

I firmly believe that gaming communities should be inclusive and global, bringing together players from different countries, and banning Chinese players feels like we're being treated like second-class players, which is neither fair nor just. I certainly hope the developers reconsider their decision and find a way to make heroes out of everyone. I would appreciate it if the developers would be transparent about the reasons behind their behaviour, as it would help people like me to be better informed.

I'm very disappointed in the way things have unfolded with Blizzard, and fuck you.

Almost a year since OW2 released they shove it onto steam (red flag) with some bow's and sparkles to try make it look good to another community.
Sadly activation (really there's no point saying blizzard.. that company died a long time back) think that their player base doesn't use other platforms like steam and thought we weren't here to help inform new people before they jump in.

As an original OW1 player (shout out to mercy mass ress) by 2022 the game was more than done. Played it out of habit at that stage. Then the announcement of OW2 and PVE content and all these other fabulous things felt like it could breathe life into the old girl.
As with most triple A companies it was all hype and zero follow through. What we got was an update, a reskin and oooooh its a team of 5 now.. not 6.  DPS are fairly redundant as tanks can do as much and more dps and last longer... healers can dps and keep themselves alive.. basically trying to make it so it didn't matter what you played anymore for the most part. 
The whole PVE content that the hyped never came and they just tried to ignore the topic until later some terrible posts about why it wasn't there blah blah blah.

The actual reason was.. they focused all the time/effort of doing PVE content into copy pasting other battleroyal type microtransactions etc into overwatch. Season passes.. pointless trinkets and stickers etc 
Everytime you log in you are met with these pushy 'adverts' for the store which is full of junk.

Overwatch has many trolls/terrible people etc... but now the game was now free to play... and that in itself brought in a sea of new trolls/clowns who just came on annoy others and don't care about losing the account. 
I uninstalled the game after 3 months... it offered NOTHING new.. just a more cartoonish feel to the game and general (imo) lowering of quality in favour of  'BUY THINGS IN STORE NAU' approach. 

My suggestion, don't support them. 
The negative reviews aren't bots or 'bombing' the game to be lelelel etc.. it's so people know what they are potentially supporting before they get to know what's going on. 

This company no longer cares about the players and are so focused on making money (which is fine, its a business ofc) but  from VERY overpriced mico-t's (I mean they are probably the most expensive ive seen and the worst looking items to boot). And they push it.. HARD!

The game is average and while you might get some fun out of it... please do not be fooled into buying battlepasses etc. It just fuels their greed. I'd be happy to support any game via battle pass if the company and design wasn't such a blatant FU to players.

[h1]若敢来犯,定叫你好评如潮[/h1]

       你所言虽不虚，然《守望先锋®2》乃动视暴雪己行之全新自主研制之射击游戏。
       今每周掌控之战局，可斩获金币六十，月累计二百四十金，折合日常生活之月入七元二角，推算经历三十有一之周，约七月有余，金皮得以入账。然守望先锋壹需金币千枚，升级并藉箱中机缘而得，惟超越多数人（尔亦在内），正为吾骄傲所系。
       岂惟守望先锋责在供予所求，抑亦乐于娱人，岂能屈就尔情?即庶凭不放尔于戏境，无徵责，可铭忆守望未欠，亦可铭感暴雪之良苦用心，为我悉心创造之OW2，更无偿开示于众，尔犹不知足，应谨铭，我辈皆择之OW，非OW择我，不善可辞退，暴雪、OW不应为我所欠，我等应谢暴雪、OW之德，及创作班底辛勤二载余，毋宜于此谏责官方以求补偿。
       尔曰我所言不然，想必乃不识二零一六年夏日之真谛也。

Stop complaining

This is not a new game, but a cash-grab update to Overwatch 1. The justification for OW2 was to introduce all-new substantial player vs. enemy gameplay (PvE), but that was just (unceremoniously) cancelled.

The only reason OW2 was launched was to squeeze more money out of the IP with $40 battle passes and $20 skins. The quality and integrity of the game is gone.

Now OW2 is simply a worse version of OW1 with a predatory shop and battle pass, and TERRIBLE MATCHMAKING. You will STRUGGLE to get fair matches.

If you play 10 games, 4 will be unwinnable, 4 will be unlosable, and 2 will be close, but FRUSTRATING and not fun.

An embarrassment of a sequel to the original Overwatch. Removed lootboxes (which was the only way to get free cosmetics) and replaced it with a shop that allows you to buy skins/bundles with Overwatch coins that can only be purchased with real world money. amazing features like looking for group, leveling/level borders, etc. from OW1 was removed. Heros are locked behind a battlepass for that season forcing you to wait months to play the new hero as a free-to-play user. AND DON'T TRUST A WORD OF WHAT BLIZZARD SAYS, EVERYTHING THEY PROMISE IS UNDERWHELMING OR CANCELLED.

Pienso que el juego tiene un hate exagerado. Si bien Blizzard es una compañía que ha demostrado tener un ambiente laboral infernal y ha tenido acciones anti consumidor varias veces, siento que esta injustificado el odio que se le da a este juego. En mi opinión juegos como Apex tienen skins aun menos trabajadas que las que se ven aca y por dar otro ejemplo, Valorant tiene skins mucho mas caras y pases de batalla que tampoco son la gran cosa. Esta reseña no es para defender a Blizzard(ojala Microsoft haga cambios pronto), es mas bien para defender a Overwatch. El juego hace unos años murio por malas decisiones (Personajes rotos y que existieran muchas habilidades que te inmovilizaran completamente) pero actualmente pienso que es divertido de jugar, a diferencia de juegos como Valorant o Apex, este hero shooter es el único juego competitivo donde de verdad me divierto, hay gente que se queja de que existan ciertos personajes fáciles, pero a mi me parece un aspecto positivo, ya que le da mas accesibilidad al juego y hay variedad en cuanto maneras de jugar.A pesar de que algunos personajes se sientan planos, hay varios que tienen una historia de trasfondo interesante como minimo, pero mas que los personajes, me parece que la historia del mundo del juego es buena, lo malo es que recien se esta empezando a avanzar en ese aspecto (En los cortos de overwatch 1, la historia nunca empezaba XD), asi que en el aspecto de personajes, pienso que Team fortress 2 es superior en cuanto a personalidad.
La comunidad del juego tiene su toxicidad, pero no es nada del otro mundo, es lo mismo de cualquier juego competitivo (Aunque mas tolerable en comparación al LOL y al CSGO en mi experiencia), pero hubo un momento de mi vida donde conocí a mucha gente en el juego y fue una bonita experiencia.
Yo creo que Blizzard cometió un gran error al anunciar esto como una secuela con PVE, seguramente si hubieran hecho como Valve cuando anuncio Counter-Strike 2 (El concepto es el mismo si lo piensas bien, incluso tiene menos novedades que Overwatch 2) el juego hubiera recibido muchísimo menos hate.
Y bueno, en cuanto a la monetizacion, para mi es el aspecto donde mas se justifica la critica, no vale la pena "invertir" en las skins, son carismas xd y en mi opinión solo algunos pases de batalla valen la pena.
PD: Como ex-jugador de TF2 me averguenza que haya jugadores de ese juego que dan reseñas negativas solo porque si, si prefieren tf2 jueguen tf2, si prefieren ow, jueguen ow, pero no hay necesidad de tirarle hate a ninguno de los 2 juegos, ni que fuera guerra de consolas xDDDDDDD
PD 2: MUERE BLIZZARD

J'ai commencé à jouer en décembre 2020, dans la période la plus creuse pour Overwatch sur les nouveautés, mais après l'avoir acheté 5€ et avec tout de même une base de joueurs toujours présente. J'ai appris à apprécier la mécanique de jeu, et j'y revenais volontiers un peu chaque soir.

De ma perspective de joueur récent, depuis la sortie d'Overwatch 2, je n'ai jamais eu autant de nouveau contenu à essayer. De rien en 2 ans, on passe à de nouveaux héros, de nouvelles maps, de nouveaux modes de jeu, tous les 2-3 mois sans que le jeu ne m'ait imposé le moindre achat. L'équilibrage est très bon depuis les dernières saisons, et les nouveaux thèmes de saisons toujours fun à jouer.

J'étais intéressé par le PVE parce que j'ai envie de continuer à découvrir le lore d'Overwatch, donc forcément je suis un peu déçu qu'il n'arrive pas dans la forme prévue à son annonce, mais tant que le contenu arrive et que le PVP évolue à ce rythme là, je continuerai à y revenir.

lets break down their 'about' section

30+ heroes: you only start with ~10, the rest have to be earned through gameplay unless if they're in the battlepass or you can buy them all for 15usd. real slick blizzard.

5v5 action: 6v6 was the original, why remove 2 players from a match?

Live service: lets patch our shitty game post launch, with things that should have been patched at launch, also day one dlc.

Captivating universe: is in segments, buy multiple smaller bites than us giving you the whole thing
